name: ZED CHOP
description: OS: This operator is only supported under the Microsoft Windows operating system.
summary: OS: This operator is only supported under the Microsoft Windows operating system.

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
NOTE

OS: This operator is only supported under the Microsoft Windows operating system.


The ZED  reads positional and plane tracking from the ZED camera. It can additionally use a UV to find plane in the room, and return information about that plane such as it's size/orientation either relative to the camera, or the room itself.
NOTE: This  works with the Stereolabs ZED hardware.	
For more information and to know what ZED SDK to install refer to the ZED article.
See also ZED TOP and ZED SOP.
zedCHOP_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 





  active - When 'On' data is captured from the ZED camera.



  camera - Selects which ZED camera to use.



  cameratransform - 



  resetcameraposition - Zeros out the current camera position, effectively makes the current position the new origin.



  resetcameratransform - Zeros out the current camera position, effectively makes the current position the new origin.



  planeorientation - Enables plane at point, which returns the position of the plane corresponding the UV coordinate.



  getplane - Returns the camera position relative to the initial position of the camera. A tx, ty, tz triplet of channels will be output for the position of the camera in meters. An rx, ry, rz triplet will be output for the orientation.



  u - Sets the U coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.



  getplanepulse - 



  v - Sets the V coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.



  planereferenceframe -  - Controls if the panel coordinates will be given relative to the camera or the world.

 world - camera -

  planenormal - Returns nx, ny, and nz normal channels of the plane.



  planepointu - Sets the U coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.



  planeposition - Returns tx, ty, and tz position channels of the center of the plane.



  planerotation - Returns rx, ry, and rz rotation channels for the plane.



  planepointv - Sets the V coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.



  planesize - Returns size of the bounding rectangle of the plane.



  planeposition - Returns tx, ty, and tz position channels of the center of the plane.



  planerotation - Returns rx, ry, and rz rotation channels for the plane.



  planenormal - Returns nx, ny, and nz normal channels of the plane.



  planesize - Returns size of the bounding rectangle of the plane.



  bodytracking -  - Body tracking allows for tracking human skeletons that are found in the video frame. Each mode uses an AI model that will need to be trained one for your . This will take several minutes, but only needs to be done once per model per machine, as long as the  isn't changed. For models where the 'Joint Mode' parameter is disabled, the outputs will be 'Absolute'.

 off - Body Tracking is disabled. skeleton18 - Tracks an 18 joint skeleton as described in this article. skeleton34 - Tracks an 34 joint skeleton as described in this article. The positions and rotations are relative to the parent joints, as described in that article, where the 0 joint is the 'root' joint.

  maxbodies - The maximum number of bodies that will be tracked.



  body3d - Enable to output 3D positions. Rotations will be included if the Joint Mode is set to 'Relative'.



  jointmode -  - Controls if the joint values are given in absolute in scene or relative to each other.

 absolute - Absolute XYZ positions of each in space, given in meters. relative - 3D skeleton positions and rotations in heriachical terms, each relative to a parent joint.

  body2d - 2D normalized UV coordinates for each joint, giving their position within the image.



  aspectcorrectuv - Apply a correct to the UVs so they as aspect correct.



  referenceframe -  - Selects the reference frame for plane position.

 world - Plane position outputs are relative to the initial position of the camera. camera - Plane position is relative to the initial position of the camera.



  timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.



  scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page.



  srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

  exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

  autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.



  exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).





Extra Information for the ZED  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Start of the  interval in samples. - Number of samples in the . - The samplerate of the channels in frames per second. - Number of channels in the . - 1 if  is  enabled, 0 otherwise. - A count of how often the export connections have been updated.
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\nwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditorwikieditor2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
CHOPs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.



To "pulse" a parameter is to send it a signal from (1) an exported CHOP channel or (2) a python command or (3) a mouse click that causes a new action to occur immediately. A pulse via python is via the .pulse() function on a pulse-type parameter, such as Reset parameter in a Speed CHOP. A pulse from a CHOP is typically a 0 to 1 to 0 signal in an exported channel.



A Link. The grey dashed lines between nodes is a Reference or Link that indicates one operator is getting data from another operator from any Operator Family.


The grey dashed lines between nodes is a Reference (or Link). A Reference is (1) a Parameter Reference, a parameter in an OP that is a name or path to another operator, (2) a Node Reference, an expression in a parameter or DAT script that contains the name or path of another operator, (3) a DAT Cell Reference or (4) a CHOP Channel Reference.


A Link or Reference is a dashed line between nodes that represent other data flowing between nodes. Examples are CHOP Exports, node Paths in parameters, and expressions in parameters referencing CHOP channels, DAT tables and other nodes. In contrast is a Wire that connects nodes in the same Operator Family.



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



Each SOP has a list of Points. Each point has an XYZ 3D position value plus other optional attributes. Each polygon Primitive is defined by a vertex list, which is list of point numbers.



The Graphics Processing Unit. This is the high-speed, many-core processor of the graphics card/chip that takes geometry, images and data from the CPU and creates images and processed data.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=ZED_CHOP&oldid=29690"
		Category: CHOPs

Examples are CHOP Exports, node Paths in parameters, and expressions in parameters referencing CHOP channels, DAT tables and other nodes. In contrast is a Wire that connects nodes in the same Operator Family.



The term "Frame" is a measurement of time used (1) in the Timeline, (2) as a time-unit in CHOPs, and (3) as a time unit in movie files that are read into TOPs and written out from TOPs. The frame rate is the frames per second (FPS).



Each SOP has a list of Points. Each point has an XYZ 3D position value plus other optional attributes. Each polygon Primitive is defined by a vertex list, which is list of point numbers.



The Graphics Processing Unit. This is the high-speed, many-core processor of the graphics card/chip that takes geometry, images and data from the CPU and creates images and processed data.



A Time Slice is the time from the last cook frame to the current cook frame. In CHOPs it is the set of short channels that contain the CHOP channels' samples between the last and the current cook frame.



A parameter in most CHOPs that restricts which channels of that CHOP will be affected. Normally all channels of a CHOP are affected by the operator. TOPs have Channel Mask, a similar feature.



samples-per-second of a CHOP. Each CHOP in your network has a sample rate. In contrast, the overall timeline has a Frame Rate, which is the number of frames to cook and display per second, generally your monitor display frequency, default 60.



Exporting is the connection of CHOP channels to parameters of operators. The output of each exporting CHOP is one or more channels, active only while the CHOP Viewer is on. The current value of a channel can be exported to a parameter of any operator, overriding that parameter's value. See Parameter.



An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The location of an operator within the TouchDesigner environment, for example, /geo1/circle1, a node called circle1 in a component called geo1. The path / is called Root. This path is displayed at the top of every Pane, showing which Component's network you are currently in. To refer instead to a filesystem folder, directory, disk file or http: address, see Folder.



Every operator in TouchDesigner has a set of control Parameters that can be integer or floating point numbers, menus, binary toggles, text strings or operator paths, which determine the output of the operator.



TouchDesigner is a hierarchy of components. "root" is the top-most network in the hierarchy. The Network Path or Path for root is simply /. A typical path is /project1/moviein1.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=ZED_CHOP&oldid=29690"

parameters.name: Active
parameters.label: Active
parameters.description: active - When 'On' data is captured from the ZED camera.

parameters.name: Camera
parameters.label: Camera
parameters.description: camera - Selects which ZED camera to use.

parameters.name: Camera Transform
parameters.label: Camera Transform
parameters.description: cameratransform -

parameters.name: Camera Position
parameters.label: Camera Position
parameters.description: resetcameraposition - Zeros out the current camera position, effectively makes the current position the new origin.

parameters.name: Camera Transform
parameters.label: Camera Transform
parameters.description: resetcameratransform - Zeros out the current camera position, effectively makes the current position the new origin.

parameters.name: Plane Orientation
parameters.label: Plane Orientation
parameters.description: planeorientation - Enables plane at point, which returns the position of the plane corresponding the UV coordinate.

parameters.name: Get Plane
parameters.label: Get Plane
parameters.description: getplane - Returns the camera position relative to the initial position of the camera. A tx, ty, tz triplet of channels will be output for the position of the camera in meters. An rx, ry, rz triplet will be output for the orientation.

parameters.name: U
parameters.label: U
parameters.description: u - Sets the U coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.

parameters.name: Pulse
parameters.label: Pulse
parameters.description: getplanepulse -

parameters.name: V
parameters.label: V
parameters.description: v - Sets the V coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.

parameters.name: Plane Reference Frame
parameters.label: Plane Reference Frame
parameters.description:
planereferenceframe -  - Controls if the panel coordinates will be given relative to the camera or the world.

 world - camera -

parameters.name: World
parameters.label: World
parameters.description: world - camera -

parameters.name: Normal
parameters.label: Normal
parameters.description: planenormal - Returns nx, ny, and nz normal channels of the plane.

parameters.name: Plane Point U
parameters.label: Plane Point U
parameters.description: planepointu - Sets the U coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.

parameters.name: Position
parameters.label: Position
parameters.description: planeposition - Returns tx, ty, and tz position channels of the center of the plane.

parameters.name: Rotation
parameters.label: Rotation
parameters.description: planerotation - Returns rx, ry, and rz rotation channels for the plane.

parameters.name: Plane Point V
parameters.label: Plane Point V
parameters.description: planepointv - Sets the V coordinate of the point in the image to extract plane position.

parameters.name: Size
parameters.label: Size
parameters.description: planesize - Returns size of the bounding rectangle of the plane.

parameters.name: Plane Position
parameters.label: Plane Position
parameters.description: planeposition - Returns tx, ty, and tz position channels of the center of the plane.

parameters.name: Plane Rotation
parameters.label: Plane Rotation
parameters.description: planerotation - Returns rx, ry, and rz rotation channels for the plane.

parameters.name: Plane Normal
parameters.label: Plane Normal
parameters.description: planenormal - Returns nx, ny, and nz normal channels of the plane.

parameters.name: Plane Size
parameters.label: Plane Size
parameters.description: planesize - Returns size of the bounding rectangle of the plane.

parameters.name: Body Tracking
parameters.label: Body Tracking
parameters.description:
bodytracking -  - Body tracking allows for tracking human skeletons that are found in the video frame. Each mode uses an AI model that will need to be trained one for your . This will take several minutes, but only needs to be done once per model per machine, as long as the  isn't changed. For models where the 'Joint Mode' parameter is disabled, the outputs will be 'Absolute'.

 off - Body Tracking is disabled. skeleton18 - Tracks an 18 joint skeleton as described in this article. skeleton34 - Tracks an 34 joint skeleton as described in this article. The positions and rotations are relative to the parent joints, as described in that article, where the 0 joint is the 'root' joint.

parameters.name: Off
parameters.label: Off
parameters.description: off - Body Tracking is disabled. skeleton18 - Tracks an 18 joint skeleton as described in this article. skeleton34 - Tracks an 34 joint skeleton as described in this article. The positions and rotations are relative to the parent joints, as described in that article, where the 0 joint is the 'root' joint.

parameters.name: Max Bodies
parameters.label: Max Bodies
parameters.description: maxbodies - The maximum number of bodies that will be tracked.

parameters.name: Body 3D
parameters.label: Body 3D
parameters.description: body3d - Enable to output 3D positions. Rotations will be included if the Joint Mode is set to 'Relative'.

parameters.name: Joint Mode
parameters.label: Joint Mode
parameters.description:
jointmode -  - Controls if the joint values are given in absolute in scene or relative to each other.

 absolute - Absolute XYZ positions of each in space, given in meters. relative - 3D skeleton positions and rotations in heriachical terms, each relative to a parent joint.

parameters.name: Absolute Position
parameters.label: Absolute Position
parameters.description: absolute - Absolute XYZ positions of each in space, given in meters. relative - 3D skeleton positions and rotations in heriachical terms, each relative to a parent joint.

parameters.name: Body 2D
parameters.label: Body 2D
parameters.description: body2d - 2D normalized UV coordinates for each joint, giving their position within the image.

parameters.name: Aspect Correct UVs
parameters.label: Aspect Correct UVs
parameters.description: aspectcorrectuv - Apply a correct to the UVs so they as aspect correct.

parameters.name: Reference Frame
parameters.label: Reference Frame
parameters.description:
referenceframe -  - Selects the reference frame for plane position.

 world - Plane position outputs are relative to the initial position of the camera. camera - Plane position is relative to the initial position of the camera.

parameters.name: World
parameters.label: World
parameters.description: world - Plane position outputs are relative to the initial position of the camera. camera - Plane position is relative to the initial position of the camera.

parameters.name: Time Slice
parameters.label: Time Slice
parameters.description: timeslice - Turning this on forces the channels to be "Time Sliced".  A  is the time between the last cook frame and the current cook frame.

parameters.name: Scope
parameters.label: Scope
parameters.description: scope - To determine which channels get affected, some CHOPs use a  string on the Common page.

parameters.name: Sample Rate Match
parameters.label: Sample Rate Match
parameters.description:
srselect -  - Handle cases where multiple input CHOPs' sample rates are different. When Resampling occurs, the curves are interpolated according to the Interpolation Method Option, or "Linear" if the Interpolate Options are not available.

 first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.label: Resample At First Input's Rate
parameters.description: first - Use rate of first input to resample others. max - Resample to the highest sample rate. min - Resample to the lowest sample rate. err - Doesn't accept conflicting sample rates.

parameters.name: Export Method
parameters.label: Export Method
parameters.description:
exportmethod -  - This will determine how to connect the  channel to the parameter. Refer to the Export article for more information.

 datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: DAT Table by Index
parameters.label: DAT Table by Index
parameters.description: datindex - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the index of the channel in the . datname - Uses the docked  table and references the channel via the name of the channel in the . autoname - The channel is the full destination of where to export to, such has geo1/transform1:tx.

parameters.name: Export Root
parameters.label: Export Root
parameters.description: autoexportroot - This path points to the root node where all of the paths that exporting by Channel Name is : are relative to.

parameters.name: Export Table
parameters.label: Export Table
parameters.description: exporttable - The  used to hold the export information when using the  Table  Methods (See above).
